question.title: Add in matrix
question.content:
This time Ninja is doing research on a matrix of size ‘N’ X ‘M’ initialised with ‘0’. He performs ‘Q’ operations where each operation is denoted by two integers [ a, b ] and he increments the value of the element present at [x, y] in the matrix such that 1 <= x <= a and 1 <= y <= b.

Ninja is busy doing some other work so he needs your help to know the occurrence of the maximum number in the matrix after all operations.

For Example: If one operations is [2, 2] then

Note:

Indexing of matrix starts from [1, 1] i.e. first element of matrix is [1, 1].
Input Format:
The first line of input contains an integer 'T' representing the number of test cases.

The first line of each test case contains three integers ‘N’, ‘M’ and ‘Q’ denoting the number of rows, number of columns of the matrix and number of operations respectively.

The next ‘Q’ lines contain two space-separated integers denoting the operation.
Output Format :
For each test case, return a single integer denoting the number of occurrences of the maximum number.

The output for each test case is printed in a separate line.

Note:

You do not need to print anything. It has already been taken care of. Just implement the given function.
Constraints :
1 <= T <= 5
1 <= N <= 200
1 <= M <= 200
1 <= Q <= 200
1 <= A <= N
1 <= B <= M

Time limit: 1 second

Sample Input 1:

2
3 3 2
2 2
3 3
4 4 3
1 3
3 1
2 2

Sample Output 1:

4
1

Explanation of Sample Output 1:

Test Case 1: we can see in the image below how we get four occurrence of 2.


Test Case 2:  we can see in the image below how we get one occurrence of 3.

Sample Input 2:

2
4 4 4
1 1
2 2
3 3
4 4
3 4 3
1 4
2 2
3 3

Sample Output 2:

1
2

rephrased.body: Given a matrix of size N x M initialized with 0. Perform Q operations. Each operation is defined by two integers [a, b]. For each operation, increment the value of the element at [x, y] in the matrix where 1 <= x <= a and 1 <= y <= b. Determine the number of occurrences of the maximum value in the matrix after all operations.

testcases.explanation: After the operations, the maximum value in the matrix is 2. There are four occurrences of 2 in the matrix.
After the operations, the maximum value in the matrix is 3. There is one occurrence of 3 in the matrix.
After the operations, the maximum value in the matrix is 4. There is one occurrence of 4 in the matrix.
After the operations, the maximum value in the matrix is 3. There are two occurrences of 3 in the matrix.

hints: Try to find the intersection of all operations.
